JobFullDesc:
Overview



The CRM Database Administrator will implement and manage database of customer contact and sales data, maintain data integrity, implement front line support and onboard new marketing, service and sales colleagues. The successful candidate will work collaboratively with Business to support CRM processes globally.  The individual in this role will be working in a fast-paced, agile environment with a diverse team that possesses a true passion for technology, transformation, and outcomes.  This individual will understand Dynamics platform and customer service-related solutions, stay up to date on industry best practices, and a passion for modern digital technologies. A self-starter attitude, excellent communication, and dedication to innovation are critical to this role.




Responsibilities



Provide Global CRM support.Onboard new users including initial communication and basic training. Manage database access.Creation and maintenance of existing Help documentation.Ensure data integrity.Data analysis in support of Marketing, Sales and Service.Work with the CRM Manager to initiate the design, development, and execution of feature enhancements and perform user administration.Create Reports and Dashboards to deliver business insights for our Field Service, Expert Center, and Service Sales teams.Perform QA testing and assist with User Testing for iterative development cycles. 




Qualifications



Qualifications2+ years’ experience in a CRM Analyst role. Experience with Microsoft Dynamics highly preferred.Strong analytical skills.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Ability to interact with colleagues from multiple countries and cultures. Ability to maintain good working relationship with other departments and internal customers.Extensive experience with Microsoft Suite, primarily Excel. Access and Power BI a plus. Behavioral CompetenciesQuality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness, meticulous attention to detail.Quantity - Completes work in timely manner; Strives to increase productivitTeamwork - Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.Professionalism - Reacts well under pressure and high-volume workload situations.Treats others with respect and consideration.Operates with integrity, transparency, and humility.Acts as a true company owner to advance the overall interests of TA Instruments. Carries a broad global perspective of markets, tech, and trends.Balances clear strategic thinking and accountability in execution to deliver results. Actively creates the conditions for TA Instruments people and teams to succeed. 




Company Description



Waters Corporation (NYSE: WAT), the world's leading specialty measurement company, has pioneered chromatography, mass spectrometry and thermal analysis innovations serving the life, materials, and food sciences for more than 60 years. With more than 7,000 employees worldwide, Waters operates directly in 35 countries, including 15 manufacturing facilities, with products available in more than 100 countries. Our team focuses on creating business advantages for laboratory-dependent organizations to enable significant advancement in healthcare delivery, environmental management, food safety, and water quality.    Working at Waters enables our employees to unlock the potential of their careers. Our global team is driven by purpose. We strive to be better, learn and improve every day in everything we do. We’re the problem solvers and innovators that aren’t afraid to take risks to transform the world of human health and well-being.
